revised_title: The Effects of Organic and Inorganic Compounds on Liver Cells
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the effects of various organic and inorganic compounds on liver cells. They discovered that some compounds, like pilocarpine, stimulate liver cells and increase secretory activity, while others, like aniline, may have a destructive effect on certain cells and cause the splitting of iron-containing organic compounds. The study provides valuable insights into the physiological actions of drugs and their chemical structures on liver cells.
